title:
Astrometry meets Pulsar Timing Arrays: Synergies for Gravitational Wave
  Detection
authors:
N. M. Jim\'enez Cruz, Ameek Malhotra, Gianmassimo Tasinato, Ivonne
  Zavala
abstract:
High-precision astrometry offers a promising approach to detect low-frequency
gravitational waves, complementing pulsar timing array (PTA) observations. We
explore the response of astrometric measurements to a stochastic gravitational
wave background (SGWB) in synergy with PTA data. Analytical, covariant
expressions for this response are derived, accounting for the presence of a
possible dipolar anisotropy in the SGWB. We identify the optimal estimator for
extracting SGWB information from astrometric observations and examine how
sensitivity to SGWB properties varies with the sky positions of stars and
pulsars. Using representative examples of current PTA capabilities and
near-future astrometric sensitivity, we demonstrate that cross-correlating
astrometric and PTA data can improve constraints on SGWB properties, compared
to PTA data alone. The improvement is quantified through Fisher forecasts for
the SGWB amplitude, spectral tilt, and dipolar anisotropy amplitude. In the
future, such joint constraints could play a crucial role in identifying the
origin of SGWB signals detected by PTAs.
